question.text: If you are provided a set of resistances, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mn>4</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mn>6</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>8</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>.</mo></math> Connect these resistances to obtain an equivalent resistance of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfrac><mn>46</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>.

options.text: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>6</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> are in parallel with <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>4</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>8</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> in series

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>4</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>6</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> are in parallel with <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>8</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> in series

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>4</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> are in parallel with <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>6</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>8</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> in series

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>6</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>8</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> are in parallel with <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>4</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> in series

solution.text:
We can arrange the circuit like above now on solving we get a simplified circuit, 

here, both the resistance are connected in series then resultant resistance will be, 

Req=43 Ω+14 Ω=463 Ω, in the other case we can not get this result.
